fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61600].
{panel}
Currently in JIRA if someone is added or removed as a Watcher in a specific issue, we do not have track on when the user was added or removed.

As a JIRA Administrator I would like to have this information in the History & Activity tab, as we have for Participants field in Service Desk projects.

Example:
 !Screen Shot 2016-06-20 at 10.34.49 AM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Watcher field should appear in History & Activity tab

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61598].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
* Ordering search results by a multi-line text field produces inconsistent results for issues that have no data for that field. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a multi-line text customfield in a JIRA instance having a few projects and issues.
# Enter data into random issues for this custom field.
# Restrict the custom field to a few projects using the customfield configuration option.
# Re-index the instance.
# Search for issues on the instance and order by your customfield

h3. Expected Results
When you order the results by the customfield in ASC order, issues that have data in that field should be sorted first before those where the field is blank, and vice-versa for DESC order.

h3. Actual Results
Issues with no data for the sorted text field, will always appear at the top regardless of wether you sort by ASC or DESC order.

h3. Workaround
Setting the context of the affected text field to Global.
fields.summary: Ordering search results by a multi-line text field provides inconsistent results on large instances
JIRA start-up message is misleading - You can now access JIRA through your web browser.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61594].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
The options of custom fields that were disabled are returned via REST request. Affected custom fields include:
* Select List (single choice)
* Select List (multiple choices)
* Select List (cascading)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure a custom field of any of the affected type listed above
# Add multiple options
# Disable one option and verify that it is not shown in the screens
# Run the following REST request 
{code:borderStyle=solid}
GET /rest/api/2/issue/createmeta?expand=projects.issuetypes.fields
{code}
# Monitor the custom field options returned

h3. Expected Results
Only non-disabled entries should be returned in allowedValues

h3. Actual Results
All the custom field options are returned in {{allowedValues}} json array

h3. Notes
Similar request from [Atlassian Answers|https://answers.atlassian.com/]: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/274145/hidden-options-for-custom-fields-via-rest-api

h3.Workaround
No workaround is available as of now
fields.summary: disabled customFieldOption entries returned in allowedValues in GET issue/createmeta Rest Api

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61593].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When an anonymous user views a dashboard, such as System Dashboard, and the Dashboard only contains gadgets to which they do not have access, it will display as a white page.

Alternatively, if it contains other gadgets, the non-accessible gadgets appear as whitespace

h3. Environment
* JIRA 1000.73.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit System Dashboard so that it only contains Activity Stream or Issues Assigned to Me, for example.
# Logout, and access dashboard directly as Anonymous user

h3. Expected Results
Dashboard should display some sort of message at least so it doesn't appear to be a GUI issue

h3. Actual Results
Screen appears blank as in attached screenshot

h3.Workaround
If you wish for your anonymous users to access the JIRA dashboard, add a few gadgets they will have access to view.
fields.summary: As anonymous user, dashboard displays as white screen when it contains gadgets that are not visible to anonymous users
Translation of a custom field allows only 255 characters

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61589].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
JIRA *Indexing* health-check checks the state of the search index is consistent with the database. If JIRA Re-index failed for non-*issue* objects: comments, entities, etc and Lucene index is not consistent, it doesn't report the problem. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Run re-index
# While re-indexing running, delete some part of Lucene data: rm -rf jira_6.4/caches/indexes/comments/*cfs
# Wait for Index completes (with errors)
# Run *Indexing* health-check,


h3. Expected Results
It should report the problem. 

h3. Actual Results
It doesn't report the problem. JQL search is not consistent and might lead to Dashboard/filters errors. 

h3. Notes
See related https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-61577

h3.Workaround
Go to *Administration* > *System* > *Indexing* and check if you see error like:
bq. JIRA is unable to perform a background re-index at this time because the index files are either missing or corrupted.
fields.summary: JIRA health-check doesn't report Lucene corruption

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61579].
  {panel}

I just had a thought, I would like to be able to quickly link an issue or page without having to tell it what to link.

The idea would be to have a "Quick Link" box where you post the URL to the issue/page and have it automatically pick up on it. The quick link would be focused for an easy paste of the URL. See attached image for a mock up.

If you paste a JIRA issue, it would automatically fill in the issue number and "guess" the relation?

If you paste a confluence page, it would automatically move to the Confluence Page option and maybe ask for an anchor if not provided, or something similar.

I know it's a bit picky and possibly a waste of time, but thought it would be a neat suggestion if anyone feels inspired.
fields.summary: "Quick Link" from modal window

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61577].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
JIRA throws exception with 500 code for REST API {{rest/api/2/reindex/progress}} call after locked re-index failed. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Run re-index
{code:borderStyle=solid}
curl -v -u admin:pass -X POST  http://127.0.0.1:8080/rest/api/2/reindex?type=FOREGROUND
{code}
# While re-indexing running, delete some part of Lucene data: rm -rf jira_6.4/caches/indexes/comments/*cfs
# Check status using REST API {{/rest/api/2/reindex/progress}}, it should return something like:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
{"progressUrl":"/secure/admin/jira/IndexProgress.jspa?taskId=11311","currentProgress":65,"currentSubTask":"Currently working on: Issue index","type":"FOREGROUND","submittedTime":"2016-06-20T15:11:03.867+0200","startTime":"2016-06-20T15:11:03.868+0200","success":false}
{code}
# Wait for Index completes (with errors)
# Call REST API {{/rest/api/2/reindex/progress}}

h3. Expected Results
Call doesn't fail and returns valid data:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
{"progressUrl":"/secure/admin/jira/IndexProgress.jspa?taskId=11312","currentProgress":100,"currentSubTask":"Currently working on: PortalPage index","type":"FOREGROUND","submittedTime":"2016-06-20T18:09:14.081+0200","startTime":"2016-06-20T18:09:14.084+0200","finishTime":"2016-06-20T18:09:27.658+0200","success":true}
{code}

h3. Actual Results
Call fails with 500 error:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
org.codehaus.jackson.map.JsonMappingException: No serializer found for class com.atlassian.jira.util.SimpleErrorCollection and no properties discovered to create BeanSerializer (to avoid exception, disable SerializationConfig.Feature.FAIL_ON_EMPTY_BEANS) )
        at org.codehaus.jackson.map.ser.impl.UnknownSerializer.failForEmpty(UnknownSerializer.java:52)
        at org.codehaus.jackson.map.ser.impl.UnknownSerializer.serialize(UnknownSerializer.java:25)
        at org.codehaus.jackson.map.ser.StdSerializerProvider._serializeValue(StdSerializerProvider.java:610)
        at org.codehaus.jackson.map.ser.StdSerializerProvider.serializeValue(StdSerializerProvider.java:256)
        at org.codehaus.jackson.map.ObjectMapper.writeValue(ObjectMapper.java:1604)
        at org.codehaus.jackson.jaxrs.JacksonJsonProvider.writeTo(JacksonJsonProvider.java:558)
        at com.sun.jersey.spi.container.ContainerResponse.write(ContainerResponse.java:306)
        at com.sun.jersey.server.impl.application.WebApplicationImpl._handleRequest(WebApplicationImpl.java:1437)
        at com.sun.jersey.server.impl.application.WebApplicationImpl.handleRequest(WebApplicationImpl.java:1349)
        at com.sun.jersey.server.impl.application.WebApplicationImpl.handleRequest(WebApplicationImpl.java:1339)
        at com.sun.jersey.spi.container.servlet.WebComponent.service(WebComponent.java:416)
...
{code}
 
h3. Notes
(Optional - If Necessary)

h3.Workaround
# After initiating reindex job, remember "progressUrl" link from reply, eg: "/secure/admin/jira/IndexProgress.jspa?taskId=11312"
# If call to {{/rest/api/2/reindex/progress}} returns error 500, check _progressUrl_ for possible related error.
fields.summary: JIRA throws exception with 500 code for rest/api/2/reindex/progress call

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61576].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When creating a ticket that uses a 'Field has been modified Validator' on the description field, JIRA does not display the error message specified in the validator settings

h3. Environment
Cloud JIRA v1000.73.0


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new validator on a workflow step using the FIeld has been modified Validator
# Make sure you have specified an error message
# Attempt to create a new ticket leaving the field you specified for the validator empty


h3. Expected Results
JIRA should display the error that you provided in the validator settings

h3. Actual Results
JIRA displays a generic error message stating:

We can't create this issue for you right now, it could be due to unsupported content you've entered into one or more of the issue fields. If this situation persist, contact your administrator as they'll be able to access more specific information in the log file.

 
h3. Notes
The error message specified in the validator settings appears to get logged in the JIRA log

{noformat}
2016-06-20 10:14:12.032962500 Caused by: com.opensymphony.workflow.WorkflowException: This field is required.
{noformat}

This also appears to effect the 'Field Required Validator' validator as well.

h3.Workaround
Remove the validator from the field or create custom fields for this project and mark them as required.
Customers can use the 'Field must not be empty during the transition.' validator as well.

h3. Additional information
This appears to be affecting post functions as well with the same generic error being displayed
fields.summary: JIRA displays generic error message instead of error specified in workflow validator settings
Ability to see due date in the card

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently it is only possible to set the Permission scheme and Notification Scheme during project creation via a REST API call.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide REST API calls for setting up work flow scheme, issue type scheme and issue type screen scheme when creation project via rest api call.
fields.summary: Provide creation of Workflow, Issue Type and Issue Type Screen-Scheme over REST API calls

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61567].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently JIRA is not able to send a client certificate in two-way SSL configuration. 
The reason for this feature is in JIRA 7, to improve gadget load performance JIRA needs to be able to connect back to its own URL. 
If the URL points to a reverse proxy that has two-way SSL enforced, e.g. possibly via Apache HTTP Server's {{SSLVerifyClient}}, then JIRA would need to be able to present a client certificate to the proxy. This fails and a "handshake_failure" is thrown.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow JIRA to send a client certificate when requested. 
 
h3. Workaround 
Configure Apache HTTP to not ask for client certs from JIRA host, e.g. similar to question below:
http://serverfault.com/questions/411858/allowing-users-in-from-an-ip-address-without-certificate-client-authentication
fields.summary: Allow JIRA to use two-way SSL with mandatory client certificate

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61566].
  {panel}

h3. Environment
* JIRA version 6.4.13
* JIRA version 7.1.7

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a CSV file which includes an inactive user as Watcher
# Import issue via csv using external system import


h3. Expected Results
Inactive user should not be added as watcher since the user no longer have permission to view the issue.

h3. Actual Results
Inactive user is added as watcher since the user no longer have permission to view the issue.
 
h3. Notes
* Unable to reproduce this issue in JIRA version 7.1.7 due to [JRA-61179|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-61179] bug

h3.Workaround
Do not include inactive users in CSV import field.
fields.summary: Import issue via csv using external system import allows inactive users to be added as watcher
User email visibility setting should not affect REST responses

fields.summary: Does not have access to jira

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61559].
  {panel}

Cloud dashboard issues - reverted pie chart display to earlier version; filter option does not have edit option to create

Pie chart used to show sections in text with numbers under the chart, now it is just the chart. 

Filter Results cannot be edited when being added to a dashboard which makes it unusable.

See screenshot
fields.summary: Atlassian Cloud dashboard issues - reverted pie chart display to earlier version; filter option does not have edit option to create

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61557].
  {panel}

Im just curious why someone thought the JIRA color palette needed to change? This looks like a major step backwards. (The pie chart changed, so did the horizontal bar chart, and the Created vs Resolved chart.)
* The softer color palette (that was there yesterday) was modern and clean... these new Vivid bright primary colors - hard colors - looks like someone designed this in the mid-1990s. 

Sorry guys, but this looks terrible. It looks like it was designed by a 60-year old with a copy of Office 98. For the love of God, change it back

You guys took a magical UI and stepped backwards more than a decade.

----
(edit) 
More problems I noticed:
1. You changed the font size and made it smaller. Change it back
2. The data in the pie charts is now missing. It was replaced with cartoonish leader lines that make it much more difficult to determine where the data is pointing. You basically rendered the pie chart useless.
3. The donut chart was perfect... its still listed in the Gadgets under pie chart, but if you try to add the donut chart back, you cant. Augh

This is really frustrating. We took a lot of time to set up these dashboards - and now they look totally different. I would be embarrassed to show this to a potential client.
fields.summary: Why change the Dashboard Color Palette in JIRA? It's terrible

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61553].
  {panel}

Problem:

We currently have a custom field in JIRA for issue types, type A and type B. Issues can change back and forth between these two task types at anytime. We would like to update the workflow so that issues must be re-accepted by the assignee whenever they are edited to go from "A" to "B" or vice versa.

Solution:

Add a post functions or feature to JIRA execute a transition when a custom field value is changed.

Workaround:
None
fields.summary: Execute transition based on custom field value

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61548].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
The current Mail queue gives administrator information such as what emails are in the queue and if it is sending an email at the very time. This does not tell administrator if the mail queue is currently stuck or what is the reason of it being stuck.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add a checker to check the current status of the mail queue, for example:
* To check if the mail queue is actually sending mail or populating mail by filter subscription
* Provide information of the last time a notification mail was delivered
* Show a portion of the error from the log indicating what causing outgoing mail failure
 
h3. Workaround 
[Mail queue REST API|https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/mail-queue-api/overview] can be use to run in external script in interval to see the number of mails in the mail queue.
fields.summary: Show status of Outgoing Mail
Allow users to scroll Workflow dropdown menu items if it can't fit the view
Avatar for user account in User Management

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61543].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

JIRA Outgoing mail stop sending mails out to users for roughly 4 hours when it is processing Group Filter Subscription with the particular group has more than 1700 users.

h3. Environment
* 500,000 issues
* 2000 users
* SMTP outgoing mail configured

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a JQL filter that uses {{currentUser()}} function
# Has a group that consist of 1700 users
# Set a Group Filter Subscription to use the group and JQL filter created

h3. Diagnostic
Generating thread dumps when Mail queue is stuck show long running thread of the following:
{noformat}
"Sending mailitem com.atlassian.jira.mail.SubscriptionMailQueueItem owner: 'username(username)'" #110 prio=4 os_prio=-1 tid=0x0000000085c7e800 nid=0x1640 runnable [0x000000008fb1e000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
	at org.apache.lucene.index.SegmentTermDocs.read(SegmentTermDocs.java:157)
	at org.apache.lucene.search.MultiTermQueryWrapperFilter.getDocIdSet(MultiTermQueryWrapperFilter.java:122)
	at org.apache.lucene.search.ConstantScoreQuery$ConstantWeight.scorer(ConstantScoreQuery.java:139)
	at org.apache.lucene.search.BooleanQuery$BooleanWeight.scorer(BooleanQuery.java:298)
	at org.apache.lucene.search.IndexSearcher.searchWithFilter(IndexSearcher.java:542)
	at org.apache.lucene.search.IndexSearcher.search(IndexSearcher.java:532)
	at org.apache.lucene.search.IndexSearcher.search(IndexSearcher.java:463)
	at org.apache.lucene.search.IndexSearcher.search(IndexSearcher.java:433)
	at org.apache.lucene.search.IndexSearcher.search(IndexSearcher.java:356)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.DelegateSearcher.search(DelegateSearcher.java:165)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.providers.LuceneSearchProvider.runSearch(LuceneSearchProvider.java:566)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.providers.LuceneSearchProvider.getHits(LuceneSearchProvider.java:294)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.providers.LuceneSearchProvider.search(LuceneSearchProvider.java:421)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.providers.LuceneSearchProvider.search(LuceneSearchProvider.java:413)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.providers.LuceneSearchProvider.search(LuceneSearchProvider.java:104)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.providers.LuceneSearchProvider.search(LuceneSearchProvider.java:92)
	at com.atlassian.jira.mail.SubscriptionMailQueueItem.getContextParams(SubscriptionMailQueueItem.java:336)
	at com.atlassian.jira.mail.SubscriptionMailQueueItem.sendSearchRequestEmail(SubscriptionMailQueueItem.java:174)
	at com.atlassian.jira.mail.SubscriptionMailQueueItem.send(SubscriptionMailQueueItem.java:126)
	at com.atlassian.mail.queue.MailQueueImpl.sendBuffer(MailQueueImpl.java:66)
{noformat}

h3. Expected Results
Outgoing mail continue to send out while Group Filter Subscription is processing the mails to be added in the Mail queue

h3. Actual Results
Mail queue is stuck, no outgoing mail is send. Manually flushing mail queue does not work.
 
h3. Notes
Filter Subscription that will generate the mails for each users will obtain a lock on the Mail queue on MailQueueImpl#addItem. The mail sender couldn't take lock for MailQueueImpl#sendBuffer to send those mails that already in the Mail queue due to it being locked by Filter subscription.

h3.Workaround
Depending on use-case:
# Set Group Filter Subscription to use a group that has a smaller user count <200 users.
# Create a mailing list in Mail Server to be configured for the Filter Subscription. Create a dummy user in JIRA to be assign with the mailing list and the user will be the one subscribing to the Filter Subscription. Users who should be receiving mail subscription needs to be part of the mailing list.
fields.summary: Outgoing Mail Stopped Working due to Large Group Filter Subscription

h3. Problem Definition

When upgrading JIRA using the installer, as soon as it finishes, JIRA starts up automatically. Some users need to change a few settings before starting such as change JVM parameters and add custom files.

h3. Problem Definition

When creating an issue from e-mail, JIRA reads only 4 parameters:
The subject of the issue, that is used to create the summary of the ticket
The Body of the e-mail, which will be used to create the description of the issue
Attachments, which are attached automatically to the ticket
The issue key (optional), if JIRA recognises the issue key he will add the information to the ticket with the respective issue key

The user want to assign a sprint to an issue create by e-mail, although there is no parameters set for this field.

h3. Suggested Solution
 
Create a parameter to assign an issue created from e-mail directly to a sprint.

h3. Workaround 
Assign the issue manually after created, on the board.

h3. Summary
Cloud Customers are unable to view or edit Components in their project though they appear in the Summary Page

h3. Environment
* 1000.73.0 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Unable to reproduce as new Components created show in the Components view

h3. Expected Results
All Components show

h3. Actual Results
Looking at the Project Summary, we see multiple components listed, however if we click the Components link in the sidebar, no components are shown.  Noticed that the URL for this Components Page is {{https://URL/plugins/servlet/project-config/PROJECTKEY/administer-components}}

Using a different URL {{https://URL/plugins/servlet/project-config/PROJECTKEY/components}}, we can see the Components that were created
 
h3. Notes
Attempted to create Components in the 'components' URL and they show in 'administer-components'

h3.Workaround
Navigate to the this Components page:
{{https://URL/plugins/servlet/project-config/PROJECTKEY/components}}

  {panel}

h3. Summary
By default *Due Date* is using datepicker field type . However , JIRA let to change date picker settings based on [Changing the Due Date Input Format|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira064/changing-the-due-date-input-format-720415918.html] documentation . In JIRA UI and database , *Due Date* information is displaying as date and time , but retrieving information using REST API only provide date information.

h3. Environment
* JIRA Software 7.1.7

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to *Administration > System > Look and Feel* .
# Edit *Day/Month/Year Format* to {{dd/MMM/yy h:mm a}}
# Then , go to *Administration > System > General Configuration > Advance Settings*
# Edit *jira.date.picker.java.format* to {{dd/MMM/yy h:mm a}}
# Edit *jira.date.picker.javascript.format* to {{%d/%b/%y %l:%M %p}}
# Then , create an issue an insert *Due Date*
# In view issue screen , you can see *Due Date* information is with date and time . Check in database , it displaying the information too . Below is the screenshot .
!Screen Shot 2016-06-16 at 11.15.34 PM.png|thumbnail!  
!Screen Shot 2016-06-16 at 11.19.23 PM.png|thumbnail! 
# Then , retrieve information using GET /rest/api/2/issue/issue-key

h3. Expected Results
Due Date information in REST API response showing date and time information

h3. Actual Results
Due date information in REST API response showing date information only . 

 !Screen Shot 2016-06-16 at 11.17.29 PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: "Due Date" field display only date information in REST API response

h3. Problem Definition

We need project templates in JIRA, since we need to create the same issues for the same assignees every time. For example, on my team John may be the person on my team to set up their phone but Jim is the person to set up their computer. I need the original ticket to kick-off tasks that automatically go out to my team.
The purpose of the new hire request ticket is to gather all of the information we need to set up a new employee. Then, using the information entered, new tasks should be assigned to the team members which I have pre-configured. For example, John will always be the person to set up phones and Jim will always be the person to set up computers.

h3. Suggested Solution
 
Need to create project templates where we have pre-defined ticket with tasks, sub-tasks and assignees.

h3. Workaround 
Use Bob Swift CLI on Cloud

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

h3. Time Since Issue Report renders incorrect values when Last Viewed date field is selected.

h3. Environment
jira.atlassian.com current running version
v7.1.2#71006-sha1:8e7e309:node2
Can also be reproduced with a standalone JIRA Core 7.1.7 running with H2 evaluation database

h3. Steps to Reproduce
In jira.atlassian.com:
# Go to [https://jira.atlassian.com https://jira.atlassian.com/]
# Browse issues by lastViewedField: PROJECT = JRA AND lastViewed >= 2016-01-01
# Change the results to List View, add the Last Viewed column.
# You will notice various different dates
# Go to Project / JRA / Reports
# Select Time Since Issue report
# Select "Last Viewed" field, leave other fields as default

In a fresh instance:
# Install JIRA Core 7.1.7 with any database (including H2 evaluation mode)
# Create one project
# Create one issue
# On the next day, without viewing this issue, navigate to Project / Reports / Time Since Issues Report
# Select "Last Viewed" field, leave other fields as default

h3. Expected Results

In jira.atlassian.com:
# Have entries distributed across dates as the search result

In a fresh instance:
# Have one entry last viewed on the previous day

h3. Actual Results
# All entries appear in the current (last) day
 
h3. Notes
I believe this happens because although Last Viewed is a Date field, it's not indexed in Issue index. This field it is calculated from the UserHistoryItem database table.

h3.Workaround
Generate manual report for "Last Viewed Date" exporting search results to CSV or Excel

h2. Summary

When viewing a dashboard as a wallboard, the gadget table header background is white

h2. Steps to Reproduce

# Go to any dashboard containing a gadget with a table view
# Click 'View as wallboard' from the Tools menu

h2. Expected Results

The gadgets are correctly displayed on the wallboard, with table headers on the same black background as the wallboard.

h2. Actual Results

The gadgets with a table have headers with a white background color, making the header text unreadable.

h2. Notes

This happened specifically on two dimensional filter statistics, using 'status' as the value on 'XAxis'. That uses lozenges on the regular dashboard, perhaps that is the cause?

h2. Workaround

No workaround available.
fields.summary: When viewing a dashboard as a wallboard, the gadget table header background is white

h3. Problem Definition

The user is not able to automatic create linked issues.

h3. Suggested Solution
 
I need to create a ticket automatically from another ticket. What I need to be able to do with that ticket is automatically assign additional tasks to my team.

For example, on my team John may be the person on my team to set up their phone but Jim is the person to set up their computer. I need the original ticket to kick-off tasks that automatically go out to my team.

The purpose of the new hire request ticket is to gather all of the information we need to set up a new employee. Then, using the information entered, new tasks should be assigned to the team members which I have pre-configured. For example, John will always be the person to set up phones and Jim will always be the person to set up computers.

h3. Workaround 
None

h3. Summary
In JIRA issue view page having issue links from Confluence, the issue does not reflect correctly when the linked page in Confluence gets updated.


h3. Environment
JIRA and Confluence with application links set up using OAuth.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create a page in Confluence and mention a JIRA issue in it.
# Refresh the JIRA issue and notice that the Confluence page shows up in the issue links section
# Now copy the page in Confluence
# Notice that the JIRA issue now shows 2 issue links
# Now delete one of the Confluence pages
# Notice that JIRA issue still shows 2 links.
# Now purge the page in Confluence.



h3. Expected results
# JIRA should remove the link to the deleted page.

h3. Actual results
# Notice that JIRA is now still showing 2 links with one link showing : Page could not be loaded.
fields.summary: Confluence Issue Links in JIRA issues don't update when Confluence page is updated

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61439].
  {panel}

OK, so you've seen this one before. I believe JRA-36670 contains the most thorough discussion of the issue.

I'm raising this as a bug because that is exactly how the behavior feels to the end user.

Let me be clear. I get that the UX books say that every element should be aligned to the user's expectation, and that behavior should be consistent throughout the system. That's well and good, and to Krzysztof Piwowar's point in the above-mentioned ticket. 

In this case, your feature (quickly back out of a text box or close modal by pressing escape, without any confirm prompt) clearly and painfully violates the following user expectations:
* That data (changes) will not be lost. This is a completely reasonable expectation.
** To cite a clear example of this...If I'm using MS Outlook and I click to write a new email, a new window pops up. If I have made no changes, pressing 'esc' will quickly close the window.
** However, if I have made any changes, I am PROMPTED whether I want to close the window or not.
* A feature should not frustrate users or unnecessarily cause them additional time and effort.
** Judging by the number of bug tickets raised for this issue, and my own experiences, it's clear that this feature is causing frustration and additional investment of time.

I type quickly, and sometimes, things happen that break my flow. For example:
* If I bring up a right-click menu, I may instinctively press escape to close it out. Instead, I lose all my work. In fact, I just did this before deciding to write this ticket.
* Behavior is not consistent between the "create ticket" modal and the edit ticket page.
** ie if I click out of the edit box on the edit ticket page, my work is saved. However, if I click out of a text box in the create ticket modal, my work is NOT saved. Sometimes, while working quickly, I forget that the behavior is not the same.
** Thus, if for any reason I press escape while the modal is active, I lose all my work.
* If another app pops up while I'm writing, I may tap 'esc' a few times (again, instinctively :) ). This will cause me to lose all my unsaved work in the ticket.

So, either:
a) This is a bad feature that should be removed.
or, more likely,
b) JIRA is missing a feature to check for changes, and prompt the user to confirm changes if they have been made.

The latter would take all the pain away, while presenting the user with a predictable and efficient experience.

I sincerely hope that this feedback can help your product team improve the feature set. JIRA is an incredible piece of software that I use for most of my day. I can't imagine life without it. However, I'm one lost chunk of work away from doing all of my writing in Word or a 3rd party editor, and only copying it to the ticket once it's complete. This would be a pain, but far better than losing my work on a semi-regular basis.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61433].
  {panel}

We currently have over 10,000 "active" users in JIRA and a 15,000 user license for JIRA Data Center.

As a rule we only deactivate users who no longer have a valid UBS account (i.e. an entry in LDAP)

Of these 10,000+ users around 50% are actually inactive.  The remaining 50% are still active in LDAP but are highly unlikely to use JIRA.  In fact most only have an account because at some point they reported, commented or updated a JIRA issue from an instance that has now been consolidated/migrated.  I would like to be able to deactivate these users to save license costs and I am aware of existing tooling (the user deactivator tool, for example) to do just this.

The problem is that if I deactivate a user who subsequently tries to login they will fail and this will result in a support request to reactivate.

So my request is that accounts can be automatically reactivated on login.

Roy
fields.summary: Automatically reactivate deactivated users on login

h3. Bad tokenization while applying JQL suggestion in unfinished statement
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open JQL search
# Write incomplete query: "project ="
# Place cursor after letter 'p'
# Select any suggestion from the list

h3. Expected Results
suggestion changes the whole word, i.e. "priority ="

h3. Actual Results
suggestion changes only letter 'p': "priorityarent   =  "
 
h3. Notes
Also reproducible on following queries:
* "project = "Customer Ops"  AND "
* "project = "Customer Ops"  AND assignee "

Because of the same reason WORKS, while it shouldn't the following query:
* "project = "Customer Ops" and assAND reporter = currentUser() " -> "project = "Customer Ops" and assigneeAND reporter = currentUser() "

Works OK if query is complete: "project = "Customer Ops"", "project = "Customer Ops"  AND assignee = admin"

h3. Summary
When trying to quick create an issue in a JIRA backlog with many issues, the issue type cannot be rendered on the screen because the types are cut off by the bottom of the browser window. Note: this only occurs when the number of issues in the backlog consumes the majority of the screen.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a JIRA Scrum project
# Create a large number of issues for your backlog
# Depending on the size of your screen, the number required to trigger the bug will vary. Essentially you will need the backlog to reach the bottom fourth of the screen.
# Try creating a new issue and changing the issue type for the backlog by clicking the down arrow next to *What needs to be done?* 

h3. Expected Results
The pop up box displays the full list of issue types as shown below:
!expected_view.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results
The full list of issue types is not displayed because the pop-up window is cut off by the bottom of the browser window, as shown below:
!backlog_create_issue.png|thumbnail!


h3.Workaround
If you adjust the size of the browser window by dragging right corner of the browser window to make it smaller and then scroll down, the issue type pop-up will become fully visible.

h3. Summary
When adding a group to a role in a project, if the group name contains a space it will only show up after type the entirely name.

h3. Environment
Tested on JIRA 7.1.6 and 7.0.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a group as *group test*
# Open the project roles screen;
# Click in *Add users to a role*;
# Start typing the group name;

h3. Expected Results
JIRA pops up groups the matching groups.

h3. Actual Results
It will display the *No Matches* message until you type the complete group name.
 
h3. Notes
Group names such as *group-test* and *groupTest* work just fine.

h3.Workaround

# Remove the spaces in the group name or replace the space for a dash, example: (*group-test*).

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61394].
  {panel}

When I add a comment on a JIRA I can control the visibility. I typically either leave it as the default or choose "Restricted to Developers". When I _reply_ to a comment I don't have the option to select "Restricted to Developers". 

Perhaps all the comments on that reply thread inherit the visibility of the parent comment. But that isn't clear since nothing indicates the visibility is anything but the default ("Viewable by all users").

There is currently a workaround: 
# Reply to the comment with dummy text.
# Edit the comment. (When editing the comment you can change the visibility.) Change the visibility to "Restricted to Developers" or as appropriate.
# Type the real comment text.
fields.summary: Add the ability to view/control visibility of replies to comments

h2.Steps to Replicate
# Go to a JIRA Software project workflow.
# Add a post function to update custom field.
# Look for Epic Link and for value key in an Epic Link name or ID.
# Try to create a ticket from the same project.

h2.Expected Result
Issue created with updated Epic Link field.

h2.Current Result
Issue is not created and error is returned.
fields.summary: Post Function to set Epic Link field on issue creation returns error

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61382].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
FieldValidationException on URL custom field with no default value after having a default value.

h3. Environment
* Jira 7.1
* Jira 6.4.7 and 6.4.13

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install JIRA 7.1.x using default values.
# Create a new custom field of type URL field.
# Populate the custom field with a default value: https://support.atlassian.com but any link will work.
# Remove the default value by clicking "Edit Default Value, removing the text and then clicking the "Set Default" button.
# Then see this exception in the atlassian-jira.log.
# Click create an issue and see two exceptions in the atlassian-jira.log.
# Finish creating an issue and see two simular exceptions as above in the atlassian-jira.log.

Before adding a default value, there are no rows in genericconfiguration.  After adding the value then deleting it, there is a row in my test instance:
{code:sql}
10500 | DefaultValue | 10903   | <string></string>
{code} 

I have confirmed that these steps work to reproduce the issue in JIRA 6.4.7 and 6.4.13 as listed in [JRA-35222|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-35222].  The missing step to reproduce this issue in JRA-35222 was to have a value set and then deleted.

This issue has no known issues that it creates.  The only affect known at this time is the logs.

h3. Expected Results
I would not expect to have these logs.

h3.Workaround
Delete the DefaultValue associated with the com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:url from genericconfiguration.  Then restart JIRA.
fields.summary: FieldValidationException on URL custom field with no default value after having a default value.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61381].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When resizing your browser window to make it smaller, the title expands vertically to respond to the smaller width of the browser. 

The problem is that while it expands vertically, the text doesn't make full use of the horizontal space, leaving white space on the sides and causing the title to expand vertically more than it needs to.

h3. Environment
* JIRA Cloud v 1000.35.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open Search Issues page in JIRA
# Minimize browser width

h3. Expected Results
# Be able to make browser smaller and have the title be responsive as it currently is, but make use of the full available white space on the sides

h3. Actual Results
Title is squished more than needed, leaving white space on sides

h3.Workaround
Expand the browser window so title fits horizontally
fields.summary: Title does not make use of available horizontal space in detail view
Diversify Default User Avatar Selection

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61378].
  {panel}

*Problem:*
The JIRA REST API is peculiar and picky about date and time strings. It's _almost_ [ISO 8601|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601] compliant, but slightly different:
* It demands time zone offsets in the form \[\+\-\]hhmm instead of the ISO format, \[\+\-\]hh:mm.
* It fails to parse if there is no fractional seconds, even if that fraction is 0 (e.g. {{2016-06-08T23:44:57+0000}} is not accepted while {{2016-06-08T23:44:57.00+0000}} is).

These differences, while subtle,  break compatibility with standard date/time libraries, requiring the user to "fix up" library-provided strings before POSTing them to JIRA. Even worse, instead of returning HTTP 400 and indicating the error as some message (as the API docs say JIRA should), POSTs to {{/rest/api/2/issue/\{issueIdOrKey\}/worklog}} (and possibly other endpoints) return HTTP 500 if JIRA is unsatisfied with the date, giving no indication of what went wrong.

*To Reproduce:*
POST to {{/rest/api/2/issue/\{issueIdOrKey\}/worklog}} to a "started" value of some ISO 8601 date and time, e.g. {{2016-06-08T23:44:57+00:00}}

*Desired Fixes:*
# The JIRA API should accept date and time strings in standard ISO 8601 formats.
# When times cannot be parsed, HTTP 400 should be returned instead of a HTTP 500 "Internal Server Error"
fields.summary: REST API parses date/time strings poorly

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61376].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently in JIRA, users can create duplicate custom fields. This is a problem because if a user creates a custom field with the same name as a default JIRA field and adds it to screens, it can make reporting in JIRA and in Portfolio inaccurate. An example field is *Story Points*. A user could create any number of *Story Points* fields and associate them with screens, but Portfolio will only read the field with the default field ID and thus, Story Points will not populate in Portfolio.

Duplicate fields can also cause other issues and confusion for site administrators. 

h3. Suggested Solution
 Prevent users from creating duplicate custom fields or at the very least display warning messages about custom fields being created with the same name as default JIRA fields. 

An issue could arise where this solution would prevent users from importing projects because their projects have the same field name as a field already in existence in the destination instance. This could be worked around by renaming those fields in the source instance.
fields.summary: Prevent duplicate field creation

h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, users can only remove the existing attachments through the View Issue screen and it is not possible to remove them through the Edit Issue screen:

!Selection_126.png|thumbnail!

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide the ability to remove the attachments via Edit Issue screen. It would be great if JIRA can display atleast the name of the attachments and the trash icon to prevent it from taking a lot of resources while loading all attachments.
fields.summary: Provide the ability to remove attachment file through Edit Issue screen

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61365].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Highlighting text in an issue comment and then clicking 'Insert Link' (External link) produces a malformed link.

h3. Environment
JIRA 7.1.2

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Start writing a comment on an issue
# Highlight text within the comment
# Click 'Insert Link > External Link'

h3. Expected Results
Correctly formed link structure - {code}[link title|https://example.com]{code} using text highlighted in place of "link title"

h3. Actual Results
Incorrectly formed link structure - [link title]

h3. Workaround
Users can unhighlight the text, insert a link, and then replace the text appropriately
fields.summary: Highlighting text and inserting a link in an issue comment produces incorrect link syntax

h3. Summary
In JIRA 3.3.2 Lead developer was changed to project lead. However it was never changed in the workflows. 

!confusion.png|thumbnail!


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Click post function on a workflow
# You will see the option for assign to lead developer which was changed to project lead in the project UI on [JRA-7925|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-7925]

h3. Expected Results
Workflow post function would reflect assign to project lead. 
h3. Actual Results
It says lead developer instead of project lead.
!confusion.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Lead developer should be changed to project lead in the workflow.
